timeline.message:
[GEOS-9526] Run assembly attached from root folder

requried for consistent function between build_release and jenkens build server due to a known isse with the maven assembly plugin.

Signed-off-by: Jody Garnett <jody.garnett@gmail.com>

[GEOS-9526] extension contents cleanup

Signed-off-by: Jody Garnett <jody.garnett@gmail.com>

upgrade to maven-assembly-plugin 3.2.0

Signed-off-by: Jody Garnett <jody.garnett@gmail.com>

fix travis build to assembly:single

Signed-off-by: Jody Garnett <jody.garnett@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: The pushd src a few lines above means you don't need -f src/pom.xml (more specifically, as written the build will fail - remove -f src/pom.xml )
timeline.author: tbarsballe
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -294,8 +294,7 @@ else
    echo "Skipping mvn clean install -P communityRelease -DskipTests"
 fi
 
-
-mvn assembly:attached $MAVEN_FLAGS
+mvn -f src/pom.xml assembly:single $MAVEN_FLAGS -N

timeline.bodyText: I see this was deleted, but didn't see a replacement. Any reason why there was no replacement?
timeline.author: tbarsballe

replies.bodyText: This extension is no longer based on scala- Andrea rewrote it some years ago to be pure java.
replies.author: jodygarnett
